intro: Pedicularis hoermanniana, commonly known as the Hoermann's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This plant is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers, which are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It typically grows in alpine or subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. The plant's unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
